lines.text: Meyer, we have known each other since we were too young to fuck.
Twenty dwarves took turns doing handstands on the carpet.
Well
[laughs]

my oh my, you're pretty ferocious for a mom's concern, aren't ya? The rest of the time you're just some good-looking, sweet-talking, charm-oozing, fuck-happy fellow with nothing to offer but some dialogue. Dialogue is cheap in Hollywood Ben... why don't you run outside and jerk yourself a soda.
Got a light?
The way you were looking at me, I thought you were going to ask for something more interesting.
Like what?
Use your imagination.
I'm using it.
...Let me know when you're finished.
That's Bugsy Siegel's house.
He doesn't like that name.
Everybody calls him that.
Not to his face, they don't.
Why don't you go outside and jerk yourself a soda?
Joey, listen. I think you owe both of us an apology for the name that you called Virginia.
Yeah? Well, you can suck that apology right out of my dick.
Joey, what words to say. Put it out, then. All right, you know what? I'll pull mine out first. Watch. Here we go...

[unzips pants, then punches Joey in the face and beats him severely, then stops]
Joey, can ya hear me? You're lucky I didn't have a lot to drink tonight. Your apology is accepted.

[talking to Cohen after Cohen robbed him]
Well, if I were you, I'd have that money back by seven o'clock tonight.

[shouting]
FUCK YOU! Lookit me, FUCK YOU! And if I was you I'd shut my fuckin' mouth and watch my step! Yeah, *you*, Smiley! Or would ya like me to blow your fuckin' Adam's apple down your spine?

[calmly]
Excuse me, but arent' we in a public place? Maybe we'd both be better off if you just toned down your rhetoric one notch.

[Ben "Bugsy" Siegel is taking the train from New York to LA. Harry Greenberg, among those seeing him off, stayed behind to ask Ben for $50,000. Train starts in motion]
You ain't gonna kill me Ben, are you?

[Ben gives him money]
I'm going to try very hard to forget that this ever happened.
I owe you my life, Ben.
I'd say that's a fair assessment.
God bless you Ben.
Bend your knees, Harry.
Bend my knees?
When you jump from the train, bend your knees to soften the impact.
Bend my knees. OK Ben. Sure thing.
[leaves]
You thought you could steal from ME?
Everybody deserves a fresh start every once in a while.
Hey, this conversation is beneath me.
Do you always talk this much before you do it?
I only talk this much before I kill someone.
[they kiss]
I just want you to answer the question that I'm really asking; how much money have you stolen from this hotel?
Hey, look, I've done a hundred times the amount of work I would have to do to justify taking anything I could get my hands on!
How much did you get your hands on?
NOTHING! Not a cent! And I could've taken a LOT too! And you wouldn't have known the difference because you're an irresponsible, unrealistic, unreliable, undependable, philandering fuck!
